body_html:
Why am I not surprised...

We decided to hardcode the libcuda.so symlink inside nvidia-docker because too many things are broken without it, so reverting is one solution. Fixing cuDNN is a must have though.

Otherwise, as @rdadolf pointed out you could have two functions GetCudaDriverVersion and GetCudaVersion which would return the cuda version (e.g. "7.5) and "1" ("" for OSX) respectively.

body:
Why am I not surprised...

We decided to hardcode the `libcuda.so` symlink inside `nvidia-docker` because too many things are broken without it, so reverting is one solution. Fixing cuDNN is a must have though.

Otherwise, as @rdadolf pointed out you could have two functions `GetCudaDriverVersion` and `GetCudaVersion` which would return the cuda version (e.g. "7.5) and "1" (**"" for OSX**) respectively.
